newsitem.title: USA: Phoenix International in New Zealand merger.
newsitem.headline: Phoenix International in New Zealand merger.

text.p: Phoenix International Inc said Friday it will merge with Hampton Resources Ltd of New Zealond in a stock deal that will give Phoenix access to the wholesale banking market.

Phoenix, a provider of data processing systems for the retail banking sector, said the merger involved the exchange of 77,400 shares of Phoenix stock. It will account for the transaction as a pooling of interests.

Hampton's two operating subsidiaries, Priority Solutions Ltd and Priority Solutions International Ltd, developed TradeWind, an international trade finance system, and TradeCenter, a global payments system. It also provides support for clients using TradeMark, a traditional treasury banking system.

The merger "will enhance our ability to sell and support international banks in our target markets in Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa and Asia-Pacific," said Phoenix chief executive Bahram Yusefzadeh. It also provides Phoenix a foothold in the Australian and New Zealond markets.
